Updater-Brand

Iconography is a fundamental part of our messaging. Our Updater-branded icons are responsive and used across our website, emails, and partner sites.

Graphics

General

We use illustrations throughout our site. We do not use actual screenshots or photography unless they are necessary for context (for example: agent headshots or team photos). All illustrations should adhere to the following specs:

Stroke width
3-10px (proportionate to image)


Colors
2+ colors per image


Shape
Use a combination of round and hard corners

screenshots

Screenshots are simplified illustrations of our site that exist inside the following screens:


splashes

Splash illustrations introduce a page concept. While they should follow the Updater color palette, they have more flexibility in terms of color balance, shape, and line.


Grid

Updater uses a 12-column fluid grid that is built on Bootstrap 3. The size of the container responds to the user’s viewport size. The size of the elements within containers is defined as a percentage of the parent element.

As screen sizes become smaller, we can use classes to cause side-by-side elements to either shrink in percentage or stack vertically. We can also hide or show elements depending on screen size. It's our responsivility to ensure end-users on all screen sizes have an equally enjoyable experience on our site.

We use SCSS to mixin predefined styles from Bootstrap into our styles. Jump over here for more details on Bootstrap grids.

Elements

Little bits of wonderful used throughout our site

Ribbons

Ribbons are single-line statements used as headlines or to draw attention to an area. They should used sparingly so the page doesn’t begin to look like a carnival.

I'm an H2 and I'm wearing $green-darker


I'm an H2 and I'm wearing $green-lighter


I'm an H3 and I'm wearing $blue-darker


I'm an H3 and I'm wearing $blue-lighter


I'm an H4 and I'm wearing $red-darker


I'm an H4 and I'm wearing $red-lighter


I'm an H5 and I'm wearing $yellow-darker

I'm an H5 and I'm wearing $yellow-mid

Horizontal line thru text

Sometimes, we'll employ the use of a headline with a 2px line going through it.

Hi, I'm special

The same treatment might also be used to distinguish between two options.

Here's a thing
OR
Here's another thing
Tooltips

Tooltips can be added to links or to form labels to provide more detail on hover. They can also be used to describe an error on a form field.

Modals

We use modals to collect information from the user only when they shouldn't be able to continue without providing it (i.e. "Set a password so we can save your place")

It's a modal!

Hooray! You launched me!

Forms

Buttons

All buttons have a corner radius of 5px.

Normal Buttons
Disabled Buttons
Different Button Sizes

Question Module

This box appears throughout the site at appropriate times to ask a user a question about their move. It should always inform the user why the question is being asked and how it will help them.

Moving with furry friends
Are you moving with dogs or cats?

Let us know if you are moving with pets. Chances are, we can help you save money on pet food and supplies.

Alerts and Popups

Alerts
Success! Your mother loves you.
Danger! You've been mean to your mother.
Friendly reminder! Don't forget to call home.

Address Module

This box appears throughout the site any combination of a users old and/or new address, either pre-filled or with empty fields

old address
new address
